input_text:
Job Title: Project Coordinator - Events Assistant

Location: Charlottesville, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
The Department of Computer Science at the University of Virginia is seeking a Project Coordinator to act as an Events and Outreach Assistant. This position will report to Emily Stacy (Associate Project Coordinator) and will assist in events from start to finish and will be responsible for ordering food, reserving space, handling travel arrangements, etc. This position also requires a basic understanding of financial principles and will require access to the University’s financial system.

The UVA Department of Computer Science is a nationally recognized leader in computer science research and education. The department includes over 60 faculty members, 27 staff, over 200 graduate students, and 1700 undergraduates. Faculty are active in fundamental computer science and engineering research and are engaged in interdisciplinary initiatives with scientists, humanists, engineers in other disciplines and medical personnel. Our graduate students transition from students to collaborators through participation in world-class research projects. Our undergraduates are involved in research and are enriched by an integrated and challenging curriculum.

The Staff in the Computer Science Department provide exceptional support to faculty, students, and fellow staff members. The Staff’s support of faculty enables enhanced focus on research, teaching, and service. Excellent service from staff to students fosters a successful academic experience. The staff members champion each other’s success through cross-training, strong communication, and continuous self-improvement.

Duties and Responsibilities of this position include (but not limited to):

Event Responsibilities

Event support (75%) 

Arrange venues (on and off-Grounds) Purchasing supplies Scheduling logistics Set-up/clean-up arrangements Process reimbursements Travel booking Reconcile accounts (as needed) Occasional evening/weekend hours may be required 

Faculty recruitment (15%) 

Organizing/updating cloud folder systems Working closely with search chair for requirements and processes Arranging meetings with primary stakeholders Communicating continuously with all parties Day-of interview assistance including Zooms, walking candidates to and from appointments, etc. 

Faculty on-boarding (5%) 

Work with finance team & ITS for supplies orders Order business cards Collect information for website posting Place on appropriate email lists 

Faculty/Student general assistance (5%) 

Meeting support (room reservations, catering orders, be available in person for last minute requests) Other administrative duties assigned as needed 

Other

Possess exceptional interpersonal, organizational and planning skills.Be a team player who can work effectively independently as well as on a team Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication in daily interactions

Qualifications

Associates Degree or higher, 1+ year(s) experience in event support or related field, some financial experience is a bonus. 1 or more year(s) experience in event support/planning or related field. Highly organized and proactive Ability to handle multiple, competing, and simultaneous priorities effectively, and to independently research financial processing or process questions and provide appropriate direction and resolution. Other administrative, team skills are a bonus Strong communication skills Proficiency in Microsoft 365 applications This is not a fully sedentary position. Does not require heavy lifting

This position will remain open until filled. Salary of $40,000-$52,000 per year commensurate with experience and education. This is a Non-Exempt level, benefited position. This position will not sponsor applicants for work visas. The University will perform background checks on all new hires prior to employment. For questions about the position or the application process, please contact Daniel Strong, Senior Recruiter at das6zb@virginia.edu

Please apply through the University job board, Careers at UVA, and search for R0058545.

Internal applicants must apply through their UVA Workday profile by searching ‘Find Jobs’ or through their ‘Jobs Hub’. Applicants must complete an application online with the following documents: a cover letter and resume.

The University of Virginia, including the UVA Health System which represents the UVA Medical Center, Schools of Medicine and Nursing, UVA Physician’s Group and the Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, are fundamentally committed to the diversity of our faculty and staff. We believe diversity is excellence expressing itself through every person's perspectives and lived experiences. We are equal opportunity and affirmative action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, national or ethnic origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, veteran status, and family medical or genetic information.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
